name: demagogic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
trying to win support by exciting the emotions of ordinary people rather than by having good or morally right ideas: His unfunded public spending promises are particularly demagogic. Demagogic politicians were tempted to exaggerate the threat of communism. See
demagogue
More examplesFewer examplesHis demagogic style was often undemocratic.The President has faced demagogic attacks from the Right for everything he does.The murder was the work of the same leading group which was carrying on the demagogic agitation.
